DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Peripheral Nervous System Metastatic Involvement Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the status of involvement whether cancer has spread from a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic cells to the peripheral nervous system.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Peripheral Nervous System Metastatic Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._That part of the nervous system consisting of the nerves and neurons that reside or extend outside the central nervous system._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: That part of the nervous system consisting of the nerves and neurons that reside or extend outside the central nervous system.:A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: That part of the nervous system consisting of the nerves and neurons that reside or extend outside the central nervous system.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the condition or state of metastatic involvement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

PermissibleValues.value: Not involved or no clinical evidence of involvement

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not involved or no clinical evidence of involvement

Concepts.definition: Involved; connected by participation or association or use.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.
